summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) discussing public testimony by Bureau of Prisons Director Kathleen Hawk Sawyer. The email expresses concern that Sawyer's statement to the Senate Judiciary Committee about the FBI investigating a 'criminal enterprise' in relation to Jeffrey Epstein's death is inaccurate and could stir speculation.

persons.name: Kathleen Hawk Sawyer
persons.role: Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Testified before the Senate Judiciary Committee, stating the FBI was investigating the possibility of a 'criminal enterprise' in Jeffrey Epstein's death, which the email author claims is inaccurate.

persons.name: Lindsay Graham
persons.context: Questioned Kathleen Hawk Sawyer during a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing about whether the FBI was investigating a 'major malfunction' or 'criminal enterprise' in Epstein's death.

connections.description: Senator Graham questioned Director Sawyer during a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Senate Judiciary Committee Testimony on Epstein Death
events.description: Bureau of Prisons Director Kathleen Hawk Sawyer testifies before the Senate Judiciary Committee, stating in response to questioning from Sen. Lindsay Graham that the FBI is investigating the possibility of a 'criminal enterprise' in Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Bureau of Prisons Director Kathleen Hawk Sawyer testified that the FBI was investigating a 'criminal enterprise' in connection with Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Internal officials from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) believed Sawyer's statement was inaccurate.
The officials were concerned the inaccurate statement could 'stir speculation' and discussed whether Sawyer could 'walk that back' or correct it.
